reviews.text: Fairmont Mt. Tremblant was in more ways a ski lodge-which in essence is what it really is-than a typical Fairmont property.Service was attentive, breakfast in the restaurant was very good and it is centrally located.We visited in the summer,and it seemed a bit rustic, but if I were to ski Tremblant, I would definitely stay here.
reviews.title: Rustic

likes.disliked: — the fact they allowed pets in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mont Tremblant is a favourite destination of mine...winter or summer. I love to ski and the Fairmont Tremblant is as close to the "Flying Mile" quad chair as you can get. The gondola is also about a 2 minute walk away. The hotel is located at the base of the mountain and the top of the pedestrian village. What I like most about this hotel is that you can park your car upon arrival and leave it parked until you leave. The hill is steps away and so is everything else from great restaurants, rec facilities and shopping. I have only ever stayed on the hotels "Gold Floor" so I can only speak for the service there and not the rest of the hotel.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Slopeside

likes.disliked: — Amerispa and 360 rental shop on hotels lower level

reviews.text: The King Gold room was small and compact but very nicely appointed and impeccably clean. The bed was exceedingly comfortable and the shower was more than adequate. Upon stepping off the elevator a staff member meets you, sits you down and gets you all settled in very quickly. There is a private Gold floor lounge with a relaxing atmosphere and lots of free food and beverages. No need to pay for breakfast on the Gold floor, its all included. Any wish you have or information you may need is immediately provided by the attentive staff. They will make your restaurant reservations and bring your coffee and lift tickets to your door in the morning. No waiting in line! I was very pleased with the personal service I recieved on the Gold floor. The restaurant located in the hotel was very good. The food was excellent and the service was exceptional. I do, however, have to recommend Coco Pazo in the Village as an alternative if you can't get reservations in the hotels dining room. It was some of the best Italian cuisine ever! Try the creme brule! I recommend bringing your own ski equipment with you if possible. Rentals are expensive and the 360 rental shop within the hotel has terrible service. If you must rent take the short walk to Chalet des Voyesgeur located at the top of the Cabriolet. They have an abundance of staff and equipment. The process of renting is much faster and the quality of the skis and boots is much better. Avoid 360 at all costs....it may seem more convinient to just go downstairs but its NOT! The hotel also has an amazing outdoor pool and hot tub open year round. We were very happy with it but be aware that its not open in the morning....if you like to soak outside before skiing, you're outta luck. I also have to mention how dissapointed I was with the hotel spa. It is an Amerispa and I had high expectations. I was very dissapointed, the treatment rooms were not very nice and most of the staff barely spoke english and were unprofessional. It was over priced and not worh the money, if you must use a spa go somewhere else...like the Westin! Overall the hotel was great and I would stay there again if I was only in Tremblant for a night or two. If you're staying for a week or more a condo may suit you better.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a great location

likes.disliked: — Not all open due to low season

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Fairmont could not be more conveniently located. You can ski to the hotel gate; the main chair lift is about 50 metres from the hotel; the cable car and the village square both about 200m.
reviews.title: Lovely stay - a delightful hotel

reviews.text: There is an indoor pool, an outdoor pool, plus a large freeform jacuzzi, right next to the slopes, which was a wonderful way to finish the day. Our room had a lovely view over the pools to the slopes.
reviews.title: Another GREAT Stay at Fairmont Tremblant

reviews.text: This is what other hotels in Eastern Canada should strive to be like - from the moment you enter the lobby you know it's going to great.
reviews.title: Nigh on perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A welcome reception from the front desk set things off on the right foot straightaway.
reviews.title: Good Stay!

reviews.text: Bedroom was spacious, clean and everthing worked. Luggage delivered promptly, dinner was excellent and pool facilities superb.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in all aspects (service, location,amenities)

likes.liked: — overall great service, staff, layout, room comfort and luxury

reviews.text: Good location for the village centre yet just far enough away to be quiet at night.
reviews.title: Excellent Summer Vacation Experience!

reviews.text: Breakfast served on time with attentive waiters at hand - I only wish we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Wonderful. Exceeded my expectations.

reviews.text: Beautiful hotel. No complaints at all. Room was large, clean, up to date and relaxing. Everything was well maintained. Staff were friendly and responded immediately to any questions or requests. Pools were well maintained, warm and wonderful.
reviews.title: Lovely, Relaxing Stay

reviews.text: Only two downsides were:
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with professional staff

reviews.text: a) it's at the top of the pedestrian village and we had to push a baby in a stroller up there - good for working off hot chocolate and poutine! It is not stroller accessible from the terrace entrance so you have to go around the driveway in order to push a stroller. It wouldn't be good for elderly people or people with disabilities.
reviews.title: Great location, nice pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: b) the price is higher, but that is to be expected of a Fairmont property. The restaurant menu was a bit steep - $20 even for a basic breakfast, but I'm sure it would be fresh and yummy ( we didn't try it!).
reviews.title: Not up to Fairmont Standards

reviews.text: We stayed at the Fairmont Mont Tremblant for our company conference from Sept 24th to the 27th and had a great experience. While most of my review revolves around my company being there, my wife was with me as well so our experience together is being taken into account as well.
reviews.title: great luxury hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to Fairmont Tremblant for a quiet weekend getaway... That is exactly what we got. Went to AmeriSpa, service was excellent. Enjoyed to spend some relaxing time in the outdoor pools and whirlpools. Had a nice mountain view from the room. Bed was comfortable and room was clean.
reviews.title: Quiet weekend getaway
Rather unexciting
reviews.text: This is a rather ordinary hotel, without any outstanding features. It is located in a "village", which is a collection of modern buildings near a ski lift. No one lives there. Most of the shops are tawdry, although there is an upmarket jeweller's shop and an outstanding furrier's shop.

We had booked a one-room suite. It was a rectangular room with a bite taken out. There was only one small window at one end, by the sitting area. This overlooked the ski lift. If you like a small view of machinery, this is for you. The bed area had no natural light at all. W e rejected it and were shown a two roomed suite, overlooking the parking lot, with a smallish bed in the bedroom. The closet was small, as was the bathroom. It was all comfortable and clean. In the interests of protecting the environment, and without any regard to lowering the establishment's costs you understand, the sheets and towels were not changed daily unless specifically requested.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel in great location

reviews.text: Breakfast was an extensive and excellent buffet as well as a la carte served by friendly staff who always spoke adequate English.
reviews.title: The ski in/ski out Gold experience

reviews.text: We had dinner on our first night. We were first shown to a table which restaurants usually offer mugs who come in off the street. It was next to a serving station and the diner facing the wall had a view only of two round tables on which dirty dishes were placed prior to removal to the kitchen. Perfectly acceptable tables beside the windows were available, unbooked. We asked for one, were given it and were then fortunate to see a groundhog trotting happily along the path outside. Why the greeter showed us the awful table is a mystery. We spoke to her in French; the place was not busy and the waitress was not so handicapped that she could not serve a table ten feet from the serving station. Dinner cost CAN $182.19 for two (two courses each) including an interesting Canadian wine. The food was so-so.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Our second visit to the Fairmont was every bit as great as the first! This time we stayed at the very end of the ski season so it was a lot warmer- around freezing most days rather than 30 below as in February!
reviews.title: Still fabulous!

likes.liked: — Outdoor pools, great view of the village and piste

reviews.text: This hotel is exactly right for a family holiday. The rooms are spacious and there is lots of storage for bulky outdoor clothes and boots. The staff are really helpful and charming but unobtrusive.
reviews.title: Location A+, Mostly Rude Service, Excellent Food

reviews.text: Our favourite breakfast place was the Wig Wam down in the basement which is very reasonably priced but has great food. It's also great at lunchtime for soup and sandwiches.
reviews.title: We were not made to feel particularly welcome here!

likes.disliked: — Badly Managed Restaurant seating / Ski equipment rental facility

reviews.text: I used the spa this time and it was excellent.
reviews.title: Great holiday

reviews.text: The outdoor pools were as wonderful as ever. During the mornings they are practically empty because most people are skiing. My daughter and I had the whole complex to ourselves for about an hour on at least two days. The ski valet is brilliant too.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Great Value for Money for us Brits

reviews.text: good locations, nice rooms, restaurant with good food. Breakfast what expensive.
reviews.title: one of the best hotels in tremblant

reviews.text: They have even a "house dog" (golden retriever) for walks! The outdoorpool is on the small size for this amount of rooms but nice. In winter good located near the ski lifts.
reviews.title: Professional

reviews.text: This is an unassuming-looking hotel at the top of a fake French/German "village" - actually a shopping complex built into the hillside. When I noticed that they charge their customers close to $20 for a day's worth of internet access I was ready to dislike the place no matter how nice the room or good the food. .. Until a friend pointed out that you can join the "President's CLub" through the Fairmont website and have WiFi for free. My only suggestions to the hotel would be to emphasize the protocol for getting internet for free. It may be hard to believe but for people like me the hassle of internet charges at Fairmont hotels smacks of penny pinching, out-of-touchness with modernity and lack of professionalism.
reviews.title: Absolute Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After that I just could not deny it: I had a great room with the view of the mountain, the staff was young yet superfriendly and professional, nice spa, competent food, just enough distant from the "village" for there to be no noise disturbance. In other words: a great place to stay. So we stayed for a week.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: What I appreciate about hotels is the personal/extra touch. In this case, the hotel had a big friendly dog next to the reception; the dog was allowed to wonder about and was great for the kids. That was great - it shows an attitude by the management that shows a willingness to go beyond moneymaking into creating a true guest experience. Way to go, Fairmont!
reviews.title: Solid Choice But a Few Flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first ski trip to the Mont-Tremblant region. After searching for hours online we were intrigued by the slope-side ease offered by the Fairmont. We decided to spend all of our 8 days at the Fairmont.
reviews.title: Convenience, Friendly, but Noisy

likes.liked: — Ski In - Ski Out and Very Friendly
likes.disliked: — The non-stop noise coming from the mountain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At arrival our check-in went very smoothly. Temperatures outside were -30 degrees Fahrenheit and the valets were helpful in getting everything out of our car quickly so that we would not have to bare the cold. A steep $23 CAD / night gets you unlimited in/out access to your car. Valet is your only option at the Fairmont, but with temperatures dipping down in the evenings this is not necessarily a bad thing.
reviews.title: It was OK

reviews.text: Upon check-in the Fairmont provides you with "early access" passes which when accompanied by a lift ticket allow you to ride the chair lifts about an hour before everyone else to get "first tracks". We never managed to get up that early but it seemed like a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great location - problem with service

reviews.text: During out time at the Fairmont we made good use of the concierge. They were extremely helpful in making dinner reservations and always had a wonderful attitude. Friendly faces and helpfulness define our experience with all the staff members at the Fairmont.
reviews.title: Great service but double billing on checkout
timing was perfect
reviews.text: The Fairmont also provides excellent "ski valets" for complimentary check-in of your ski gear so you do not have to lug it to your room and get the hotel carpets wet. We loved this feature.
Had lots of fun, very relaxing. The "everyone's an original" deal was great value.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights for a ski & spa vacation.
reviews.title: GREAT Ski & Spa vacation

reviews.text: We arrived late (drived from Boston) and check-in was easy, several staff members greeted us, took the car/skis/luggage etc, we stayed at the "gold" level and had a "front desk" there (booked using AAA rates and saved a bunch).
reviews.title: Superb stay in a perfectly located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was very comfortable and clean with beautiful view of the mountain.
reviews.title: Very Crowded
A Comfortable Hotel
reviews.text: There is a lounge at the "gold" level with a changing buffet, the food and service was good.
